publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3925 Robin Harper: White Ribbons for Peace-That the Parliament welcomes the "white ribbons for peace" campaign by CND whereby members of the public may wear a white peace ribbon to show their opposition to a war on Iraq; notes that proceeds from the sale of ribbons are going into a legal fund that may be used to bring ministers of Her Majesty's Government before the International Criminal Court for crimes against humanity in the event that Iraqi civilians are killed or injured as a direct or indirect result of an attack on Iraq, and urges members of the public to support the campaign. R

S1M-3925 Robin Harper: White Ribbons for Peace-That the Parliament welcomes the "white ribbons for peace" campaign by CND whereby members of the public may wear a white peace ribbon to show their opposition to a war on Iraq; notes that proceeds from the sale of ribbons are going into a legal fund that may be used to bring ministers of Her Majesty's Government before the International Criminal Court for crimes against humanity in the event that Iraqi civilians are killed or injured as a direct or indirect result of an attack on Iraq, and urges members of the public to support the campaign. R Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-3925 White Ribbons for Peace (lodged on 19 February 2003) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-3925 White Ribbons for Peace (lodged on 19 February 2003) Mr John McAllion*

S1M-3925 Robin Harper: White Ribbons for Peace—That the Parliament welcomes the "white ribbons for peace" campaign by CND whereby members of the public may wear a white peace ribbon to show their opposition to a war on Iraq; notes that proceeds from the sale of ribbons are going into a legal fund that may be used to bring ministers of Her Majesty’s Government before the International Criminal Court for crimes against humanity in the event that Iraqi civilians are killed or injured as a direct or indirect result of an attack on Iraq, and urges members of the public to support the campaign. R Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Tommy Sheridan, Mr John McAllion
